info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 01 at 1:20PM EDT until April 01 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN HARRISON...JEFFERSON...COLUMBIANA...EAST CENTRAL CARROLL...MERCER...BEAVER...LAWRENCE...BROOKE AND HANCOCK COUNTIES... At 119 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Orwell to near Wintersville, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... Cranberry, New Castle, Weirton, Steubenville, Hermitage, Sharon, Salem, East Liverpool, Aliquippa, Beaver Falls, Columbiana, and Monaca. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
